results.title: Fundamentals of squash: Basic shots & tactics
results.brief_description: Emphasizes the importance of controlling the centre court position and the awareness of position in relation to one’s opponent. Demonstrates the cross-court angle, corner drop, and lob shots.

results.title: Fundamentals of public speaking
results.brief_description: A lawyer, asked for advice after a student has made a poor platform appearance, explains the basic rules for good public speaking; analyse your subject, audience and purpose; plan your material by selecting, arranging and illustrate your speech in a direct, distinct and lively manner.

results.title: Fundamentals of photography: the basic camera
results.brief_description: A simple explanation of how a camera functions showing the working of the various parts including the film holders, the lens and the shutters. A brief history of cameras is traced and the different types of camera are briefly described.
results.description: A simple explanation of how a camera functions showing the working of the various parts including the film holders, the lens and the shutters. A brief history of cameras is traced and the different types of camera are briefly described.

results.title: Fundamentals of photography: light sensitive materials
results.brief_description: This film discusses the physics of light and colour; shows how light-sensitive materials may be classified according to their light sensitivity; explains the composition of such light-sensitive materials.

results.title: Fundamentals of massage
results.brief_description: Shows proper position of patient for massage; how to perform superficial and deep stroking and the importance of rhythm in stroking; how to knead; how to perform friction; and the value of each type of massage movement. The value of each type of massaging movement are also dealt with.

results.title: Fundamentals of diet
results.brief_description: Outlines types of animals with respect to their food habits and the classes of food in the human body are shown. There are a number of minimum requirements - in food-value and in vitamin content - which the human body must have if it is to be healthy. Experiments carried out on animals demonstrates the results of deprivation of any one or more of these necessities vital to health. The film ends with suggestions for substitutes for various classes of foods which whilst they are vital for health, are often very expensive or unobtainable.

results.title: Fundamentals of carrier telephony. Pt 1.  Principles and applications
results.brief_description: Explains the use of carrier telephoning to increase the number of telephone channels on a single wire without the extra cost of wires etc. Using diagrams it shows how four voices can use the same wires without interference to each user.
